subject: Relationships
title: Same-Sex Marriage: A Global Timeline
description: Learn Same-Sex Marriage: A Global Timeline in one minute.

hook.text: The Netherlands legalized same-sex marriage in 2001. Thirty-four countries followed. Dozens still criminalize it.

buildup.text: Same-sex unions existed in many ancient cultures. Rome, China, and Native American nations recognized them.

discovery.text: The modern movement began in the 1990s with Denmark's partnerships. The Netherlands made full marriage legal first.

twist.text: In 71 countries, homosexuality is still illegal. Marriage equality remains a privilege of geography.

climax.text: Same-sex marriage rights reveal how law, culture, and morality collide differently across every border.

punchline.text: Legal in 34 countries, criminalized in 71. Geography is destiny.

quiz.question: Which country first legalized same-sex marriage?
